name: surefootedly
content:
surefootedly adverb
(WITHOUT FALLING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that means you are unlikely to fall on rough ground: He was walking as surefootedly as a mountain goat. Without thinking, she raced sure-footedly down the hill.
More examplesFewer examplesThe dogs move surefootedly over ice and crevices.The children were walking surefootedly along a dry dirt road.

surefootedly adverb
(CONFIDENTLY)
in a confident way that shows you can make good judgments in a difficult situation: Surefootedly, the company has expanded research and production facilities. A sensible strategy would be to move steadily and sure-footedly towards the end goal.
More examplesFewer examplesHe had surefootedly guided the college through some very difficult days.
